data.title: Korea: December Industrial Production Rebounded Despite The Political Uncertainty
data.description:
By Min Joo Kang

All industry output rebounded 2.3% MoM sa for the first time in four months

Mining and manufacturing Industrial production, services, and construction, all rebounded, while public administration output contracted for a third month.

data.title: Growth & Total Return Bi-Weekly Chat 02/04/2025
data.description:
This is the forum for Growth & Total Return discussion on Seeking Alpha. A new chat begins every two weeks, and all previous blogs are listed in chronological succession on the main chat page. We won't be doing any comment cleanup in the new chat, and users will always be able to refer back to previous discussions.

More on Today's Markets:

ERO Copper: Undervalued Growth Play As Copper Production Set To Double

Copper had a volatile year in 2024, ending the year up 5.5% overall, with a record high of $5.20 per pound reached in mid-May before falling back. For copper miners, this resulted in a mixed performance, with the Global X Copper Miners ETF (COPX), up 3.6% in 2024. This, however, hides the large variations in performance between miners. One company that underperformed the index was ERO Copper (NYSE:ERO), a copper-gold producer with three operational mines in Brazil, whose shares fell 14.6% in 2024. This came despite the opening of a new mine which is only beginning to ramp up, and the company’s gold operation selling into record high gold prices.

Is Geron A Buyout Target? The RPRX Deal Says No

After 34 years in the market, with the first decade trying to develop imetelstat as a drug that halts aging, Geron finally found its niche - MDS or Myelodysplastic syndrome (and MF or myelofibrosis) - and got approval from the FDA last year in MDS. Imetelstat, now known as Rytelo, has had a very strong launch, with Q3 revenues hitting $28.2mn, $9.2mn or nearly 50% above certain analyst estimates of $19mn. They are running a phase 3 trial called IMpactMF in r/r MF. This pivotal trial started in April 2021 and has an estimated primary completion date of November 2026. In December 2024, the CHMP issued a positive opinion recommending the approval of RYTELO for the treatment of transfusion-dependent anemia in adult patients with lower-risk myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS).

Toast Is More Than Just A Point-Of-Sale Company -- That's Why It's A Buy

And here’s the best part—they’re finally profitable, with $56 million in net income. Revenue is growing fast, margins are getting better, and the company just posted its first positive operating income. The stock isn’t cheap but when you look at where Toast is headed it’s worth the premium. Currently, the market is hesitating. Some investors think it’s overpriced. Others worry about the restaurant industry slowing down. But I see this as an opportunity. Toast is winning customers at a rapid pace and its payments and software business is expanding. Wall Street isn’t giving enough credit for how big this can get. That’s why I believe there’s at least a 50% upside in the next year or so.

DeepSeek Should Really Be Called ShallowSeek -- Nvidia Remains A 'Buy'

If DeepSeek is all they say, bears argue cost conscious firms will follow DeepSeek’s lead. They’ll save a lot of money by using far fewer NVDA GPUs. That, they claim, will hurt NVDA. I wrote about NVDA on 5/28/24. I said “Buy.” Since then, and factoring in the DeepSeek-rout, the stock now stands about 6% higher. The S&P 500, on the other hand, is up around 14%.

Dime Community Bancshares: Baby Bond Offers An 8.1% Yield To Maturity

Dime Community Bancshares (NASDAQ:DCOM), a regional bank headquartered in New York state, is one of the few banks in the stock market that offers both a preferred share (NASDAQ:DCOMP) and baby bond (NASDAQ:DCOMG) option for income investors. I have been back and forth on which security investors should put new money into. Back in November, I switched from the baby bonds to the preferred shares. Since that article, the baby bonds have sold off slightly and preferred shares have maintained their value. As a result, I believe the baby bond would now be the best income option for investors.

data.title: Dividend Growth Bi-Weekly Chat 02/04/2025
data.description:
Welcome to the forum for Dividend Growth Investing discussion on Seeking Alpha. A new article is posted every two weeks as a space for sharing of ideas, discussing concepts, and digging deeper on DGI. All previous blogs are listed in chronological succession on the main chat page.

As promised and with your valued feedback, we are publishing a new version of the article with some changes to make it more engaging. The structure of the article will now include a response from one of you in the community regarding your thoughts on DGI.

If you’d like to share your DGI thoughts with us in future editions, you can email us at moderation@seekingalpha.com and let us know. We’ll be looking at continuing to do this moving forward.

For a reminder, you can find our moderation guidelines for this space in our profile. And please share your thoughts below to continue the discussion and learning on DGI.

More on Dividend Growth Investing:

PepsiCo, Cisco Among 19 Companies To Announce Dividend Increases In First Half Of February

In this article I’ll look at another 19 dividend growth companies that I expect will announce their annual dividend increases in the first half of February. In addition to the companies for which I provided predictions, two other companies announced annual increases at the end of January: medical diagnostic company Quest Diagnostics Incorporated (DGX) announced a 6.7% increase to an annualized $3.20 for its 15th year of dividend growth. Quest Diagnostics now has a forward yield of 1.96%. And electric utility Eversource Energy (ES) extended its dividend growth streak to 27 years with a 5.2% increase to $3.01 per year, giving the company a forward yield of 5.22%.

5 Relatively Secure And Cheap Dividend Stocks, Yields Upto 8% (February 2025)

First, surely the market is just plain expensive and needs time to absorb the recent advances. This was reminded when a number of high-flying technology and AI-related stocks nosedived this Monday (27th) due to a panic reaction to China-based DeepSeek's announcement of much cheaper AI-language models (similar to ChatGPT). Though it is yet to be proved beyond doubt that DeepSeek's models indeed cost a fraction and are more efficient, the battle for supremacy will now be ongoing. But, you may have noticed that most blue-chip dividend-paying stocks barely budged during the tech rout; in fact, many of them gained.

Canadian Natural Resources: The Definition Of Shareholder Friendly Management

Canadian Natural Resources (NYSE:CNQ) develops and produces a mix of fossil fuels including multiple categories of crude oil, thermal oil, and natural gas. Headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, CNQ primarily operates in Western Canada but does have some international operations in the United Kingdom and Africa. CNQ is by far the largest fossil fuel producer in Canada by any measure, and is well diversified across multiple types of energy so that they are not too exposed to a price change for any one of their products.

If I Could Only Retire With 2 Funds

Retiring with dividends requires a few fundamental qualities in a portfolio. The most important is that the dividend income comfortably exceeds living expenses. This is because, firstly, to retire on dividends, you need to have sufficient dividends to pay for your living expenses. Second of all, you need a cushion because there are numerous unpredictable forces that could have a negative impact on the ability of your dividends to cover your living expenses in the future. These include inflation eroding the purchasing power of your dividends, black swan events, and sharp economic downturns that could cause dividend cuts to your portfolio. Also, unforeseen expenses could come up, such as emergency health expenditures or those following a natural disaster or something else.

Preferreds Weekly Review: B. Riley Suspends Dividends

B. Riley suspended their preferreds dividends, impacting (RILYL) and (RILYP). The shares were down 30-40% in the week and are trading at around $5.3. The dividends are cumulative and will continue to accrue. The company's longest baby bond (RILYZ) is trading at $8.95. The Feb-2025 bond is trading right around par with accrued, so the market views the repayment as certain. There is $145m of the bond outstanding.
